title: Analyzing Digital Transformation Barriers in Law Firms: Case Study and Interview-Based Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of the legal industry structure and foundational knowledge of digital technologies
context.additional_context: A project-based learning environment where students analyze digital transformation cases in real law firms, explore structural/cultural barriers, and propose alternative solutions.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain three or more key structural/cultural barriers encountered during a law firmâ€™s digital transformation process.
Learners can evaluate success/failure factors of digital transformation by analyzing case studies and interview data.
Learners can derive unique digital transformation obstacles specific to law firms by comparing them with other industries (e.g., architecture).
Learners can propose two practical strategies to balance digital transformation with existing workflows.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
